input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Jennifer: What's the matter, Bill? You look kind of pale.
Catherine: Oh, I'm just tired.
Jennifer: Why?
Catherine: Well, I've been working until around ten every night this week.
Jennifer: You should go home at quitting time today and take it easy.
Catherine: Yes. I think I will.
Jennifer: That's good. Say, how's your brother?
Catherine: He's fine, but he is awfully busy. He went to the States on a business trip two weeks ago.
Jennifer: Oh, really? Is he back yet?
Catherine: No, he won't come back for several more weeks.
Jennifer: Wow! He must have a lot to do there.
Catherine: Yes, he does.
Jennifer: I want to be sure of the time because I'm going to meet a friend at five o'clock sharp.
Catherine: Well, my watch says 4:30, and that time should be right. I set it with the radio yesterday.
Jennifer: Good.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: Jennifer and Catherine are coworkers and have a conversation about Jennifer's brother. Catherine says that he is busy with work and has been working until 10 pm every night this week. Jennifer suggests that Catherine go home early today and take it easy. Catherine agrees and says that her brother is in the United States on a business trip and won't be back for several weeks. Jennifer inquires about the time because she has a meeting scheduled at 5 pm. Catherine confirms the time with her watch, which she set with the radio yesterday.
input_text.Response B: Catherine is tired because she's been working long hours this week. Her brother is in the US on a business trip and will be gone for several more weeks. Jennifer is meeting a friend at 5 pm.

label_annotations.factors_a: This response seems to make assumptions; we can't be certain that these individuals are coworkers.
label_annotations.factors_b: I don't like the way that this response summarizes the information without mentioning that it was a conversation between two people.
